content.description: Sit start on the adjacent boulder at the base of the left arete, get low feet and good holds on the arete, pull on and then work your way up the arete with good feet and jugs the whole way. Mantel to finish at the top of the boulder.
content.location: Left arete of the Supermoon boulder, approach Super Crack 2 Area, head left up the hill to the Hillside Boulders and Supermoon is the obvious clean arete.

content.description: Stand start on the slab on the back side of the Supermoon boulder, work up the slab, reach up to the arete and then make one big move up to the lip of the boulder.This climb starts halfway up the boulder, as the first portion of the slab is low angle, this does create a poor fall zone, it would either require a good number of pads or confidence in your ability to send.
content.location: On the back side of the Supermoon boulder; approach Super Crack 2 Area, head left up the hill to the Hillside Boulders and Supermoon is the obvious clean arete. Olympus Mons is on the back side of the boulder, the climb starts about 6' or so up a very low angle slab and continues up a steeper slab.

content.description: Stand start with underclings and left foot on good foot ledge, no obvious right foot. Figure a way to tense up and pull onto the wall, make one big move up and left to the jug lip/arete, match it and then mantel the finish the same as for Supermoon.
content.location: Starting on the right side of the Supermoon boulder; approach Super Crack 2 Area, head left up the hill to the Hillside Boulders and the Supermoon boulder is the obvious clean arete.

content.description: One of the easiest to spot boulders on the Hillside, it has a large clean arete and sits right in the middle of the area.
